sen.e: Mitsune (859?-925?) was a poet of the early Heian period.

sen.j: 三十六歌仙の1人で、紀貫之、紀友則、壬生忠岑と共に古今和歌集の撰者を務めた。
sen.e: One of the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets, he was one of the compilers of the Kokin wakashu (Collection of Ancient and Modern Poems) with KI no Tsurayuki, KI no Tomonori, and MIBU no Tadamine.

sen.e: He was appointed to various posts, including Acting Junior Clerk of Kai Province in 894, Acting Senior Clerk of Tanba Province in 907, and Senior Secretary of Izumi Province in 917.

sen.e: Shall I break a branch off as it pleases me? The white chrysanthemums of the first frost fool me when I put my hand out.

sen.e: That is why they call the moon a stretched bow! It aims straight for the horizon edge of the mountains.
